definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: I finally reach Leifeng, the entry fee a bargain 40 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 最後我來到雷鋒塔，門票很便宜，只要40元。

sentences.english: It' really surprises me that Xiao gives me an ticket of Olympic.
sentences.chinese: 確實比較驚喜，老肖居然送我一張奧運門票。

sentences.english: The Shanghai Expo ticket sales in Hong Kong was officially launched three months ago.
sentences.chinese: 三個月前，上海世博會的門票正式在香港開售。

sentences.english: You will have to re-submit your Request List but the ticket availability may have changed in the new round.
sentences.chinese: 重新提交時，門票的有無情況可能會有所變化。

sentences.english: Right now the Disney park charge visitors exorbitant price for food gifts and entry.
sentences.chinese: 現在迪斯尼公園的食物，禮品，門票都超貴。

sentences.english: Note: All purchasers must adhere to this ticket limit.
sentences.chinese: 所有購票者必須遵守此門票限額。

sentences.english: All the way so far there were only 'private' beach areas, with pricey entry fees.
sentences.chinese: 到目前爲止整條路還是私人浴場區，門票極爲昂貴。

sentences.english: A fantasy novel can be a ticket to a land of magic.
sentences.chinese: 奇幻小說就像一張通向魔法世界的門票。

sentences.english: Our tickets showed that our visit time was 9:15.
sentences.chinese: 我們拿到的門票顯示我們參觀的時間是在9點15。

sentences.english: He brought no milk with him, but two tickets for a bull-fight down on their table.
sentences.chinese: 他沒帶來牛奶，卻把兩張鬥牛門票放在了桌上。

sentences.english: That my father-in-law has season tickets to UNC basketball games?
sentences.chinese: 我的岳父有北卡洛來納大學籃球比賽的門票嗎？

sentences.english: Details of the matches and ticketing options will be released soon.
sentences.chinese: 比賽詳情以及於日門票預訂事宜將後公佈。

sentences.english: I spent RM200 on tickets for the baseball game with my family.
sentences.chinese: 我花了200令吉買全家人的棒球賽門票。

sentences.english: But his flying fingers definitely sell tickets.
sentences.chinese: 但他那翻飛的手指決定了門票的收入。

sentences.english: Design a ticket or an advertisement for the Ming Tombs.
sentences.chinese: 讓每名學生設計一張十三陵的門票或宣傳廣告。

sentences.english: We showed our tickets and were allowed to pass in.
sentences.chinese: 我們出示了門票，就讓我們進去了。

definition: to enter the venue for a meeting/to enter into an examination/to enter a stadium, arena etc
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to place an order/to book ahead
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
